name: Burnette Plumbing
text: I love this place it's very peaceful and me and my wife had a great vacation away from business.

resp.text: Thank you for your positive comments!! We strive to make our cabins a peaceful getaway. We appreciate your business!

name: Michael Nation
text: This is an excellent place. For the price and everything is probably the best anywhere around.

name: Devon Owens
text: This place is really nice. I was very impressed! Cute and exactly what we were looking for!

name: Lee Hunter (Leeboyfla)
text: Great little place to stay had a blast. I'd suggest you bring extra pillows and dont expect a comfy bed. Other then that its flawless.

resp.text: I know it’s been a while since you’ve visited, but Backwater Cabins is under new ownership!! We’ve replaced all mattresses and pillows to make for a more enjoyable stay. We would love to have you back to check out our improvements!

name: Heather Trowell
text: Love this place! Always clean and super friendly owners. Great place for the kids to play too.

name: Travis Eddy
text: Good place to stay while close to the water for fishing and not far for hiking

name: Kevin Barnette
text: The only experience I have had I was a little disappointed on how the, owned reacted but,other than that i was pleased

name: Dawn Ferrell
text: So cute, and homey.

name: Matthew Brown
text: Lucky their staff is nice and friendly otherwise I wouldn't have bothered with a star in the first place.I only stayed for one night and booked weeks in advanced.When I first showed up everything looked ok at the front office.Clean...yeah sure the breakfast area is small but hell the price was cheep.However despite how calm and friendly their staff is.There was no excuse for the state of the room they first put me in.I will admit I am not the most clean guy myself.But never would I dare bring guests to a room that has Roaches crawling around.Which reminds me I should have let the front staff know about the horrible caulking job they did to try and hide the mold on the bathtub.Not to mention the loose shower head.There was still forgotten items from the previous guest in the room which tells me they didn't give a dam about doing a basic cleanup in the first place.Luckily the second room the put me in was on the other side of the building.Which was MUCH cleaner and well taken care of.They also gave me a $20.00 dollar bill for the "inconvenience" of my stay when I checked out.All an all if anyone was to ask me if I would justify the price for one night.NO I would rather spend the extra $50.00 and go to the first Comfort-Inn at the area instead.

name: Brandon Little
text: I thought they were terrific. Nice rooms, a decent continental breakfast, easy access to the space center, and a swimming pool. Plus, they were very affordable for all that. They have an outdoor pool, but it's in the center courtyard, so it's secluded from the rest of the world.

name: Demeikia Houston
text: Because of the previous reviews i had my mind made up that i was not staying here. but i needed the closest and some what cheapest room to stay in. so i gave it a shot,  i called the front desk and rsvp'd my room i also asked for them to make sure the room was Superior before i got there. the lady was not only polite but had no problem seeing to my needs. once i got there i searched and searched trying to find the littlest thing wrong...but i couldn't. everything was clean and well placed! my stay at this hotel was wonderful and i would recommend it to anyone!

name: Rachel Jordan
text: I loved the place! Everyone was friendly. I had left a few things in the room and they were kind enough to let me retrieve them.

name: Cassandra Spala
text: Horrible customer service! We booked online a week before our trip for a non-smoking king bed room for 2 nights. We drove all the way from chicago to Huntsville Alabama. When we got there, all they had was a king bed smoking room or a non-smoking with 2 double beds. They said sorry, there's nothing we can do.

name: Dwight Hardwick
text: It's a Days Inn now. Very pleasant stay,nice comfortable bed,AC worked really well during this hot 4th of July weekend. Would've given 5 stars but my bathroom was kind of small. But I will be staying again.

name: erika smalley
text: Terrific stay. Had to stay here because I had a house fire. They clean up nice and they have great hospitality.

name: Jason Randolph
text: Has truck parking which is important to me. Flat screen TVs and a recliner in the king rooms. Front desk worker was exceptional. Room was clean and comfortable.

name: Norman Ravis
text: Place is disgusting. Bugs in the room, on the bed, everywhere. Stains all over the carpet, walls, and ceilings. When confronted about the bugs they said "they are just cockroaches, and baby coach roaches, they aren't b.bs" because they didn't want to say bedbugs in front of other customers. That is how disgusting this place is, they have a codename for bed bugs.

name: D'Andre Manigo
text: It was nice. There was an issue with the tub over flowing and some silverfish but ya know.

name: Matt DeBlieck
text:
Pros:
-Nice price
-Nice staff
-Comfy bed
-Decent sized room for price
-Decent continental breakfast

Cons:
-No garbage can
-Mold in shower curtain
-Bathroom floor sticky
-Small bathroom
-Bathroom door and table had small pieces missing/definite signs of damage
-No sign of vending machines (there were soda and ice machines though)
-Key system composed of pieces of plastic with holes punched in them
-Alarm on clock didn't function and clock had persistent interference from Blackberry device
-Suspicious activity from other guests on grounds at night
-No way to close thicker curtains (so no way to not be seen with the lights on
-Cleaning staff leaves lights on in every empty room

Overall:
NOT recommended for families or long stays
If you're looking for an inexpensive place to crash for a night, MAYBE two, then you'll get a decent go at the basics.

name: Jada Snow
text: The rooms are spacious clean Wi-Fi works good and the free breakfast is on point

name: Bryan Young
text: Nice place to stay the night. Plenty of places to eat near by and the hotel was very clean.

name: Albe Manton
text:
La Quinta Inn ‎
3141 University Dr Northwest
Huntsville, AL 35816

Oct 6,7,8,9 2011
Arrived on Thursday for a 4 day stay.  My first room had no cold water in the shower, the faucet was broken.
My second room I found 3 roaches within 15 minutes of being in the room and left right away.
My 3rd room was fine for the first night.
On day 2 The AC would not work.
I called for Maintenance to come fix it. They sent the assistant manager to fix it.
When he could not fix the AC he told me to "tuff it out or check out."
I went down to the front desk were they helped me, and gave me my 4th room in 2 days were the TV did not work.
I requested the Manager call me to discuss my problems, He/She would not contact me after asking every day for three days. The grounds are covered in debris, bottles and beer boxes by the Ice machines and was not pickup in the 4 days I was there. Only one Ice machine worked. They allowed large groups of men(6 to 8) to stand outside on the balcony drinking beer and would not send security.
They allowed a group of young people to have a loud party, with loud music until late at night, and would not send security
Some of the people I was there with checked out and went to another La Quinta about 2 miles down the road.
The rooms are not being maintained and the Management has an attitude that makes it feel like its your fault for complaining. I have been coming to Huntsville for business every year for 4 years and I will not stay here again. There are 2 other La Quintas within 2 miles of here with much better reputation. This hotel does not maintain the standards of any other La Quinta I have ever stayed at. It's not worth staying here just to save $5.00

name: Ryan Means
text: Kind of expensive for what it is. Mediocre rooms, not the friendliest people in the world. It's a place to sleep, that's it

name: Gideon Duvall
text: Tried 2 hotel rooms, they were both mold infested and smelled terrible.  There was black mold in the shower.  Used Hotwire so they already had my money when I showed up so I was screwed.  Do not stay here, the rooms smell like mold.

name: C G
text: While not perfect, it is well worth the price

name: Nick Nations
text:
Disgusting.
Room stunk, blood stains and burn holes on blanket, urine smell on sidewalk,  just nasty.

name: trice Carter
text: Bed bugs...stay away room 149...new name days inn

name: Joey Towers
text: Was a great place to stay

name: Jessica Kientop
text: Staff is friendly. Room needs major update. Clean, but outdated makes it seem dirty.

name: BnJ
text: Days Inn. Not Laquinta

name: Cindy Gunter
text: Nice

name: Robbie Evanoff
text: Ok

name: Deryck Moi-Thuk-Shung
text: worst experience ever

name: Rated R NYPD
text: Nice

name: Ralf Heckel
text:
(Translated by Google) Always La Quinta.

(Original)
Immer wieder La Quinta.

name: Nathan Baker
text: Great location and beach but by far the most uncomfortable king I've slept on. Please update the mattresses.

name: Matt Vickery
text: The Blue Heron house is wonderful.  We had 2 families go both with little kids.  The pool was just important to the little kids as the ocean was for the adults.  Over all location, house and hospitality was A+ 5 stars and hard to beat!  Thanks again for a wonderful trip!

name: Cashelle Rose
text: A beautiful, clean, comfortable home with access to both the beach (you have to cross a scary busy road but the button actually works) and Gulf State Park. We had a great time beaching with the kids and biking in the afternoons! There is also a small but very nice pool in the community. You can't really walk to any restaurants so be prepared for that.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Cashelle! We are so fortunate to have that pedestrian light for safe and easy crossing to the beach access! I’m happy to hear you took advantage of our direct access into the trails of Gulf State Park! We hope to have you back!

name: Danielle Ayo
text: Lovely home! Home is as pictures show. The beds are very comfortable! The kitchen has all tools and amenities. Beach is a short walk and pool most days was just to us. Can’t wait to return. So many restaurants, bars, arcades and such within only a few miles. Everything was so convenient and comfortable!

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Danielle! We are lucky to have such a perfect location for guests to enjoy all that Orange Beach and Gulf Shores has to offer!

name: Shawn Crews
text: What a wonderful vacation home! My family had such a great time!!!

resp.text: Thank you, Shawn! We would welcome you back to The Salty Mermaid anytime!

name: Debbie Geurin
text: Beautiful house in a great location!  We like the house so much we vacationed there two years in a row and hope to return again.

resp.text: Thank you, Debbie! We have some fun plans for the backyard area this Fall and hope you’ll return next year to enjoy the results!

name: Scott Manuwai
text: Epic view with a "killer' cabin/refuge.  Truly special!

name: Lee Stevenson
text:
Exceeded all our expectations.
Most comfortable bed ever in a cabin.
Cottage is just the right size with the right amenities.
We won't wait to return next year, we'll try to get back this year.
You get a full size bar of soap!
Located next to a park I thought it might get loud and crowded, that was not the case, very quiet and comfortable.
Views are incredible and plentiful.
Mentone was a sleepy town during our stay during the week and that's what we wanted.
We walked in the door to pleasant music playing and the cottage was cool and comfortable.

name: Joe Miller
text: Romantic cottage with artisan decor and luxury bedding.  Highly recommended!

name: Ken Hays
text: Great place to stay if you want to relax and unwind. Great for a couple. Sits right on the brow. Screened in back porch is awesome to sit and take in the views. Sunsets are amazing. Cottage is well furnished and very comfortable. Owners are great to work with.  This is our 6th time to stay here and we will be back. Cannot say enough about this cottage as a great place to get away from it all. Hot tub is great too

name: Kitty Hays
text: Exquisite cottage with breathtaking view.

name: Chris Collins
text: Great. It was beautiful! Great view. Old house was decorated beautifully.The hot tub never really warmed up. But we are definitely coming back.

name: Randell Hill
text: Stayed this week in Cottage 2. Awesome place for our get away. Will definitely book again.

name: Mark Ceraso
text: Very quiet and serene. Beautiful valley view and grounds. Close to center of Mentone

name: Porkchopranch
text: I may have drove by it but dont have a clue as to where it is at

name: Sharon Sides
text: Wonderful, relaxing charming, reasonable price, breathtaking views!

name: Melanie Gingerich
text: Adorable, tastefully decorated, clean, great location

name: Christina Jones
text: Very nice.

name: Brandy Rivers
text: How much for the lot for sale

name: Art Of Valor
text: Great place!

name: Tim Terry
text: Really good house for family vacation. Shower could be stronger. Thanx

name: Gregorio Santana
text: Clean and amazing with a pool. Must stay

name: MI6헌터
text: Berry good  100% korean style

name: Youngsun Choi
text: Good place

name: 김주영
text:
(Translated by Google) Both the dining and laundry atmosphere are the best.

(Original)
식사와 빨래 분위기 모두 최곱니다

Thank you for taking good care of the guest house aunts

name: 박승모 (이사@VOICE_US)
text:
(Translated by Google) Your aunt's food is terrifying and delicious,
But someone keeps bringing my running gear, size 95, so it would be small ㅠㅠ

(Original)

근데 누가 자꾸 내 런닝구를 가져 감, size 95라 작을텐데 ㅠㅠ

name: 걷자꽃길만
text:
(Translated by Google) Korean rice tastes good

(Original)
한국인 밥 맛 좋아요

name: Peggy Kalb
text: We stayed a month at The Palms. The condo was perfect for us. Southern Vacations was great to take care of us. Will return again. Thank you Ann for the one on one contact with us.

name: Madison Johnson
text: The people working there are the absolute nicest and the condo was spectacular!!! Love this rental company and will definitely be using them in the future! Highly recommend!!

name: Lewis Golden
text:
I just got off the phone with the owner of the company and these people are TERRIBLE to deal with!  First they double-booked me, then set aside a unit that wasn't comparable.  What adult couple wants to sleep in twin beds?  They kept promising a better unit might open up and when it didn't, we were inside of 30 days.  As any consumer would, I made other arrangements.  They made the initial mistake and never offered any concessions in an attempt to correct it.  The real kicker is that they kept a portion of my deposit for "processing".  BUYER BEWARE - definitely will not be doing with this company EVER!

Updated:  I didn't just "inquire" about a unit, you sent me a rental confirmation.  We were on board, but that was before you back-tracked on verbal commitments you made regarding parking passes and check-out time, which resulted in a different total amount due.  We even spoke regarding the refund, at which time you agreed to refund the full amount.  There was a clear pattern of miscommunication and failure to follow through with commitments and we made the decision to make other plans for fear of the pattern effecting our vacation in a more significant manner.  You yourself even admitted that you booked the original before knowing that it was available.  Look, problems do happen.  The difference can be seen in how you respond.  In my opinion, your response was less than satisfactory and I feel the need to make sure others know in advance who they are dealing with.

name: Suzanne Johnson
text: Amazing July 4th! Condo was great as suggested by the knowledgable and helpful staff. We will definitely use 3 Palms for our future vacations. Thanks!

name: Ray Fisher
text: My sister and I have been renting from Three Palms for several years now and our experience with them has been consistenly good.  They have been easy to work with and met all committments they have promised.  When our preferred unit was not available they have worked hard to find us a suitable alternate.  We are going down for October 2014 and looking forward to it.  I believe this will be the fourth year in a row they have helped us with a unit at Four Seasons which we like very much.

name: Daniel Dyas
text: Three Palms manages my family's condo complex. The condo facility has deteriorated in quality and Three Palms has started charging a parking fee on everyone who visits. I wouldn't advise using them.

name: Kathy Hall
text: The entire staff are always courteous and helpful.

name: Cary A
text: Best Southern Hospitality ever these ladies are nice to the point and will bend over backwards no matter what

name: Jennifer Davis
text: The realtors are very rude. I wouldn't use them. They was going to charge me $10 to print one piece of paper.

name: td beddis
text: nice place to visit, unit was wonderful, Three Palms very helpful

name: Sandy Frey
text: Good stay

name: GEORGIANA ENFELT
text: Friendly staff
